programlisting.literallayout:
=============================================================================== Output Compare management functions ===============================================================================
=================================================================== TIM Driver: how to use it in Output Compare Mode =================================================================== To use the Timer in Output Compare mode, the following steps are mandatory:
1. Enable TIM clock using RCC_APBxPeriphClockCmd(RCC_APBxPeriph_TIMx, ENABLE) function
2. Configure the TIM pins by configuring the corresponding GPIO pins
2. Configure the Time base unit as described in the first part of this driver, if needed, else the Timer will run with the default configuration: - Autoreload value = 0xFFFF - Prescaler value = 0x0000 - Counter mode = Up counting - Clock Division = TIM_CKD_DIV1
3. Fill the TIM_OCInitStruct with the desired parameters including: - The TIM Output Compare mode: TIM_OCMode - TIM Output State: TIM_OutputState - TIM Pulse value: TIM_Pulse - TIM Output Compare Polarity : TIM_OCPolarity
4. Call TIM_OCxInit(TIMx, &TIM_OCInitStruct) to configure the desired channel with the corresponding configuration
5. Call the TIM_Cmd(ENABLE) function to enable the TIM counter.
Note1: All other functions can be used separately to modify, if needed, a specific feature of the Timer.
Note2: In case of PWM mode, this function is mandatory: TIM_OCxPreloadConfig(TIMx, TIM_OCPreload_ENABLE);
Note3: If the corresponding interrupt or DMA request are needed, the user should: 1. Enable the NVIC (or the DMA) to use the TIM interrupts (or DMA requests). 2. Enable the corresponding interrupt (or DMA request) using the function TIM_ITConfig(TIMx, TIM_IT_CCx) (or TIM_DMA_Cmd(TIMx, TIM_DMA_CCx))

section.title: void TIM_OC1Init (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_OCInitTypeDef *TIM_OCInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the TIMx Channel1 according to the specified parameters in the TIM_OCInitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_OCInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_OC2Init (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_OCInitTypeDef *TIM_OCInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the TIMx Channel2 according to the specified parameters in the TIM_OCInitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_OCInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_OC3Init (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_OCInitTypeDef *TIM_OCInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the TIMx Channel3 according to the specified parameters in the TIM_OCInitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_OCInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_OC4Init (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_OCInitTypeDef *TIM_OCInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the TIMx Channel4 according to the specified parameters in the TIM_OCInitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_OCInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_OCStructInit (TIM_OCInitTypeDef *TIM_OCInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each TIM_OCInitStruct member with its default value.

entry.para: pointer to a TIM_OCInitTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

section.title: void TIM_SelectOCxM (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_Channel, uint16_t TIM_OCMode)
section.emphasis: Selects the TIM Output Compare Mode.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function disables the selected channel before changing the Output Compare Mode. If needed, user has to enable this channel using TIM_CCxCmd() and TIM_CCxNCmd() functions.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the TIM Channel This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_Channel_1: TIM Channel 1
TIM_Channel_2: TIM Channel 2
TIM_Channel_3: TIM Channel 3
TIM_Channel_4: TIM Channel 4

specifies the TIM Output Compare Mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCMode_Timing
TIM_OCMode_Active
TIM_OCMode_Toggle
TIM_OCMode_PWM1
TIM_OCMode_PWM2
TIM_ForcedAction_Active
TIM_ForcedAction_InActive

section.title: void TIM_SetCompare1 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint32_t Compare1)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Capture Compare1 Register value.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Capture Compare1 register new value.

section.title: void TIM_SetCompare2 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint32_t Compare2)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Capture Compare2 Register value.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Capture Compare2 register new value.

section.title: void TIM_SetCompare3 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint32_t Compare3)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Capture Compare3 Register value.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Capture Compare3 register new value.

section.title: void TIM_SetCompare4 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint32_t Compare4)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Capture Compare4 Register value.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Capture Compare4 register new value.

section.title: void TIM_ForcedOC1Config (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ForcedAction)
section.emphasis: Forces the TIMx output 1 waveform to active or inactive level.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the forced Action to be set to the output waveform. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ForcedAction_Active: Force active level on OC1REF
TIM_ForcedAction_InActive: Force inactive level on OC1REF.

section.title: void TIM_ForcedOC2Config (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ForcedAction)
section.emphasis: Forces the TIMx output 2 waveform to active or inactive level.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the forced Action to be set to the output waveform. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ForcedAction_Active: Force active level on OC2REF
TIM_ForcedAction_InActive: Force inactive level on OC2REF.

section.emphasis: Forces the TIMx output 3 waveform to active or inactive level.

specifies the forced Action to be set to the output waveform. This parameter can be one of the following values:

section.title: void TIM_OC1PreloadConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OCPreload)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the TIMx peripheral Preload register on CCR1.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

new state of the TIMx peripheral Preload register This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCPreload_Enable
TIM_OCPreload_Disable

section.title: void TIM_OC1FastConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OCFast)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx Output Compare 1 Fast feature.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

new state of the Output Compare Fast Enable Bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCFast_Enable: TIM output compare fast enable
TIM_OCFast_Disable: TIM output compare fast disable

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.

new state of the Output Compare Fast Enable Bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:

TIM_OCFast_Disable: TIM output compare fast disable

new state of the Output Compare Fast Enable Bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:

TIM_OCFast_Disable: TIM output compare fast disable

section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx Output Compare 4 Fast feature.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

new state of the Output Compare Fast Enable Bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCFast_Enable: TIM output compare fast enable
TIM_OCFast_Disable: TIM output compare fast disable

section.title: void TIM_ClearOC1Ref (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OCClear)
section.emphasis: Clears or safeguards the OCREF1 signal on an external event.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

new state of the Output Compare Clear Enable Bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCClear_Enable: TIM Output clear enable
TIM_OCClear_Disable: TIM Output clear disable

TIM_OCClear_Disable: TIM Output clear disable

new state of the Output Compare Clear Enable Bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:

section.title: void TIM_OC1PolarityConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OCPolarity)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx channel 1 polarity.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the OC1 Polarity This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCPolarity_High: Output Compare active high
TIM_OCPolarity_Low: Output Compare active low

section.title: void TIM_OC1NPolarityConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OCNPolarity)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx Channel 1N polarity.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the OC1N Polarity This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCNPolarity_High: Output Compare active high
TIM_OCNPolarity_Low: Output Compare active low

TIM_OCPolarity_High: Output Compare active high
TIM_OCPolarity_Low: Output Compare active low

section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx Channel 2N polarity.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the OC2N Polarity This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCNPolarity_High: Output Compare active high
TIM_OCNPolarity_Low: Output Compare active low

section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx channel 3 polarity.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the OC3 Polarity This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCPolarity_High: Output Compare active high
TIM_OCPolarity_Low: Output Compare active low

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

TIM_OCNPolarity_High: Output Compare active high
TIM_OCNPolarity_Low: Output Compare active low

section.title: void TIM_OC4PolarityConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OCPolarity)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx channel 4 polarity.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the OC4 Polarity This parameter can be one of the following values:

section.title: void TIM_CCxCmd (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_Channel, uint16_t TIM_CCx)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the TIM Capture Compare Channel x.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the TIM Channel This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_Channel_1: TIM Channel 1
TIM_Channel_2: TIM Channel 2
TIM_Channel_3: TIM Channel 3
TIM_Channel_4: TIM Channel 4
specifies the TIM Channel CCxE bit new state. This parameter can be: TIM_CCx_Enable or TIM_CCx_Disable.

section.title: void TIM_CCxNCmd (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_Channel, uint16_t TIM_CCxN)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the TIM Capture Compare Channel xN.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the TIM Channel This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_Channel_1: TIM Channel 1
TIM_Channel_2: TIM Channel 2
TIM_Channel_3: TIM Channel 3
specifies the TIM Channel CCxNE bit new state. This parameter can be: TIM_CCxN_Enable or TIM_CCxN_Disable.
